intro: Alepidocalyx amblyosepalus, commonly known as the woolly-stemmed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and large, showy flowers. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, often accompanied by prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
